analyzed: rga shi 'gag pa'i bar rnam pa bcu gnyis so //
translated: Similarly, the light side is the twelve aspects of the cessation of ignorance, etc., from the cessation of ignorance up to the cessation of old age and death.

analyzed: de'i gnyen por gyur pa lam nyid la 'gog pa'i sgrar brjod do //

analyzed: de'i phyir rig pa dang ma rig pa la sogs pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, Because of the non-existence of the entity of apprehended object and apprehending subject, such as knowledge and ignorance, and so on.

translated: The non-existence of that is the nature of the non-duality of knowledge and ignorance, and so on.

analyzed: yang na rig pa dang ma rig pa ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de /

analyzed: de'i phyir kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid rig pa dang / ma rig pa dngos po med par mtshungs pas /
translated: Therefore, the imagined nature and ignorance are the same in being unreal.

original: rig pa dang ma rig pa gnyis su med do //
analyzed: rig pa dang ma rig pa gnyis su med do //
translated: Thus, awareness and ignorance are not a duality.

original: de bzhin du 'du byed rnams dang / 'dus ma byas dang / rnam par shes pa dang / de 'gog pa nas 'gog pa dang rga shi zhes bya ba'i bar du brjod par bya'o //

translated: In the same way, one should say that formations and the unconditioned, consciousness and its cessation, up to old age and death and their cessation are not a duality.

original: 'dir dbu ma'i lam gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir dbu ma'i lam gang zhe na /
translated: What is the middle way here?

analyzed: rig pa dang ma rig pa 'di ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med par shes pa de nyid de'i rig pa bskyed @308a * //
translated: Awareness and ignorance are not a duality. The knowledge that they are not a duality is itself the arising of awareness.

original: par bya ba yang med cing ma rig pa dgag par byar yang med pa dang / 'du byed rnams spang bar bya ba yang med la /
analyzed: par bya ba yang med cing ma rig pa dgag par byar yang med pa dang / 'du byed rnams spang bar bya ba yang med la /
translated: There is no ignorance to be stopped, and no awareness to be produced.

analyzed: de 'gog pa thob par bya ba yang med pa de ltar shes pa gang yin pa de ni gnyis su dbyer med pa'o //
translated: There are no formations to be abandoned, and no cessation of formations to be attained. The knowledge that this is so is itself the absence of a duality.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba de la ;
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba de la ;
translated: The afflictions are threefold:

original: nyon mongs pa rnams ni las dang tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin pa dang / bdag nyid kyang nyon mongs par gyur pas kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //

translated: The afflictions are the cause of the afflictions of karma and birth, and since they afflict the self, they are called afflictions.

original: yang na bdag dang gzhan la gnod par byed pa'i rgyu yin pas kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na bdag dang gzhan la gnod par byed pa'i rgyu yin pas kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, they are called afflictions because they are the cause of harming both self and other.

translated: Karma arises under the influence of the afflictions, is the cause of birth, and since it afflicts the self, it is called affliction.

original: tshe yang las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis byung ba dang gnod pa thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshe yang las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis byung ba dang gnod pa thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Birth arises under the influence of karma and the afflictions, and since it is the basis of all harm, it is called affliction.

original: yang nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum du dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum du dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Again, in order to demonstrate the threefold division of the affliction of affliction, he says,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa yang rnam pa gsum ste zhes rgya cher smos so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa yang rnam pa gsum ste zhes rgya cher smos so //
translated: There are three kinds of defilement:

original: de la lta ba ni lnga ste /
analyzed: de la lta ba ni lnga ste /
translated: View is of five kinds:

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: the view of the perishable collection, etc.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug nyid rgyu ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug nyid rgyu ste /
translated: Desire, hatred, and delusion are the causes of the defilement of action.

analyzed: mya ngan la sogs pa'i rgyu dang yang srid pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are the causes of sorrow, etc., and of the continuation of existence.

analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu ni de'i rjes su mthun pa dbang po dang / don dang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bag chags kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o zhes zer ro ;
translated: Others say that the causes of desire, etc., are the faculties, objects, and improper mental attention that are favorable to them, and the residues of desire, etc., that are located in the store-consciousness.

original: / der snang ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu'o zhes de skad kyang 'dzer to //
analyzed: / der snang ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu'o zhes de skad kyang 'dzer to //

analyzed: yang srid pa la smon pa ni srid pa phyi ma 'dod pa'o //
translated: The aspiration for renewed existence is the desire for a new existence.

analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni stong pa nyid shes pa zhes rgya cher 'byung ba de la lta ba rnams kyi gnyen po ni stong pa nyid shes pa ste /
translated: The antidote to that is the knowledge of emptiness.🔽The knowledge of emptiness is the antidote to the views,

analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi yul la shes pa ni 'dir steng pa nyid shes pa'o //
translated: because the knowledge of the object of emptiness is the knowledge of emptiness here.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu'i gnyen po ni mtshan ma med pa shes pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu'i gnyen po ni mtshan ma med pa shes pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of signlessness is the antidote to the cause of attachment and so on.

original: mtshan ma thams cad dang bral pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: mtshan ma thams cad dang bral pa'i phyir ram /

analyzed: mtshan ma med pa yul du gyur pa'i shes pa ni mtshan ma med pa shes pa ste /
translated: or because the knowledge that has signlessness as its object is the knowledge of signlessness,

analyzed: kun brtags pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i stong pa nyid yul @308b du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the emptiness of the imagined attachment and so on is its object.

analyzed: yang srid par smon pa'i gnyen po ni smon pa med pa shes pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of wishlessness is the antidote to the aspiration for renewed existence.

original: yang srid par smon pa dang bral ba 'am /
analyzed: yang srid par smon pa dang bral ba 'am /
translated: Because it is free from the aspiration for renewed existence,

analyzed: yang srid pa'i stong pa nyid yul du gyur pa shes pa ni smon pa med pa shes pa'o //
translated: or because the knowledge that has the emptiness of renewed existence as its object is the knowledge of wishlessness.

translated: The defilement of action is the performance of virtuous and non-virtuous actions.

original: de'i gnyen po ni mngon par 'du mi byed pa shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni mngon par 'du mi byed pa shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: shes pa gang gis las kyis de'i yang srid pa mngon par 'du mi byed pa shes pa ste /
translated: The knowledge by which one does not perform the action that leads to rebirth is the knowledge of non-performance.

translated: And that is suchness as the object.🔽The defilement of life is rebirth.

original: yang srid pa'i rgyun to zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i 'chi ba'i srid pa dang / de'i 'og tu bar ma do'i srid pa dang / de nas yang skye ba'i srid pa'o //
analyzed: yang srid pa'i rgyun to zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i 'chi ba'i srid pa dang / de'i 'og tu bar ma do'i srid pa dang / de nas yang skye ba'i srid pa'o //
translated: The continuum of existence is the death existence that is accompanied by afflictions, the intermediate existence that follows it, and the birth existence that follows that.

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa rnams kyi ni 'chi ba'i srid pa de nyid kyi 'og tu skye ba'i srid pa'o //🔽de'i gnyen po ni skye ba med pa shes pa dang / 'byung ba med pa shes pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa shes pa'o zhes bya ba de la chos thams cad kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyis ma skyes par shes pa dang / stong pa nyid yul du gyur pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni skye ba med pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa rnams kyi ni 'chi ba'i srid pa de nyid kyi 'og tu skye ba'i srid pa'o // de'i gnyen po ni skye ba med pa shes pa dang / 'byung ba med pa shes pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa shes pa'o zhes bya ba de la chos thams cad kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyis ma skyes par shes pa dang / stong pa nyid yul du gyur pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni skye ba med pa shes pa'o //
translated: For those who have attained the formless meditative attainments, the birth existence follows immediately after the death existence.🔽The antidote to that is the knowledge of non-production, the knowledge of non-manifestation, and the knowledge of intrinsic realitylessness.🔽The knowledge of non-production is the knowledge that all phenomena are not produced by their imagined nature, and the knowledge that emptiness is an object.

original: kun brtags pa'i chos rnams kyi stong pa nyid yul du gyur pa'i shes pa ni 'byung ba med pa shes pa ste /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i chos rnams kyi stong pa nyid yul du gyur pa'i shes pa ni 'byung ba med pa shes pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of non-manifestation is the knowledge that the emptiness of imagined phenomena is an object.

original: des de dag gis 'byung ba med pa rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des de dag gis 'byung ba med pa rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they understand that those do not arise.

original: mo bsham gyi bu bzhin du med pa'i phyir dngos po'i rgyun ngo bo nyid med par shes pa gang yin pa de ni ngo bo nyid med pa shes pa'o /
analyzed: mo bsham gyi bu bzhin du med pa'i phyir dngos po'i rgyun ngo bo nyid med par shes pa gang yin pa de ni ngo bo nyid med pa shes pa'o /
translated: The understanding of the absence of intrinsic reality of the continuum of things is the understanding of the absence of intrinsic reality, because they do not exist like the son of a barren woman.

original: stong pa nyid shes pa la sogs pa shes pa rnam pa bdun po de dag ni ji skad du bshad pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs lta ba la sogs pa rnam pa bdun gyi gnyen po'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid shes pa la sogs pa shes pa rnam pa bdun po de dag ni ji skad du bshad pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs lta ba la sogs pa rnam pa bdun gyi gnyen po'o //
translated: Those seven types of understanding, such as the understanding of emptiness, are the antidotes to the seven types of adverse factors such as views, as they have been explained.

original: nyon mongs pa dang las dang / tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa de gsum /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang las dang / tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa de gsum /
translated: The three types of affliction of affliction, karma, and birth

original: rnam pa bdun du ta dad par gyur pa de dag dang bral ba ni rnam par byang ba ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bdun du ta dad par gyur pa de dag dang bral ba ni rnam par byang ba ste /
translated: are the seven types of differentiation. Freedom from those is purification.

original: bral ba ni spangs pa'o //
analyzed: bral ba ni spangs pa'o //
translated: Freedom is abandonment.

original: @309a * // gzhan dag ni de bzhin nyid dang / lam dang mya ngan las 'das pa ni rnam par byang ba ste /
analyzed: @309a * // gzhan dag ni de bzhin nyid dang / lam dang mya ngan las 'das pa ni rnam par byang ba ste /
translated: Others say that suchness, the path, and nirvana are purification.

original: 'di la lam 'dis bral ba ni bra ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la lam 'dis bral ba ni bra ba ste /
translated: Here, freedom from those is purification.

original: de ltar tshig rnam par sbyar ba tha dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar tshig rnam par sbyar ba tha dad pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because the words are different,

original: de bzhin nyid la sogs pa ni rnam par byang ba'i snyam du sems so //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la sogs pa ni rnam par byang ba'i snyam du sems so //
translated: they think that suchness and so on are purified.

original: de ltar stong pa nyid shes pa la sogs pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar stong pa nyid shes pa la sogs pas zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thus, those who know emptiness and so on,

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni stong pa nyid shes pa dang / mtshan ma med pa shes pa dang / smon pa med pa shes pa dang / mngon par 'du mi byed pa shes pa dang / skye ba med pa shes pa dang / 'byung ba med pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni stong pa nyid shes pa dang / mtshan ma med pa shes pa dang / smon pa med pa shes pa dang / mngon par 'du mi byed pa shes pa dang / skye ba med pa shes pa dang / 'byung ba med pa shes pa dang /
translated: the phrase “and so on” includes the knowledge of emptiness, the knowledge of signlessness, the knowledge of wishlessness, the knowledge of non-application, the knowledge of non-arising, the knowledge of non-occurrence,

original: ngo bo nyid med pa shes pa yongs su bsdu'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa shes pa yongs su bsdu'o //
translated: and the knowledge of non-intrinsic nature.

original: shes bya stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos rnams zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes bya stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos rnams zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phenomena that are the objects of knowledge, such as emptiness and so on,🔽are called “the phenomena that are the objects of knowledge.”

original: 'di la yang sogs pa'i sgras ni zhes bya ba stong pa nyid dang / shes bya mtshan ma med pa nyid dang / shes bya smon pa med pa nyid dang / shes bya mngon par 'du mi byed pa nyid dang / shes bya skye ba med pa dang /
analyzed: 'di la yang sogs pa'i sgras ni zhes bya ba stong pa nyid dang / shes bya mtshan ma med pa nyid dang / shes bya smon pa med pa nyid dang / shes bya mngon par 'du mi byed pa nyid dang / shes bya skye ba med pa dang /
translated: Here, the words “and so on” include the emptiness of the knower, the signlessness of the knowable, the wishlessness of the knowable, the unconditionedness of the knowable, the non-production of the knowable,

original: shes bya 'byung ba med pa dang / shes bya ngo bo nyid med pa yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid rnams yongs su bsdu'o //
analyzed: shes bya 'byung ba med pa dang / shes bya ngo bo nyid med pa yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid rnams yongs su bsdu'o //
translated: the non-arising of the knowable, and the naturelessness of the knowable, which is the characteristic of the perfected nature.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum po de dag dang ci rigs par stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i bar du mi byed de zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum po de dag dang ci rigs par stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i bar du mi byed de zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “They do not make the three kinds of defilement, up to emptiness, etc., into something existent” means that

original: shes bya stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos rnams ni bshad ma thag pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / las dang tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dag tha dad par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos rnams ni bshad ma thag pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / las dang tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dag tha dad par gyur pa'o //
translated: the phenomena of the knowable, such as emptiness, etc., are different from the defilements of action and life just explained.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “They are naturally empty, etc.” means

original: stong pa nyid shes pa la sogs pas stong pa nyid du mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid shes pa la sogs pas stong pa nyid du mi byed pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of emptiness, etc. does not make the knowable empty, etc.

original: ci rigs par zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ci rigs par zhes bya ba la /
translated: As is fitting.

original: 'dir rigs pas ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir rigs pas ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here is the fittingness:

original: stong pa nyid shes pa shes bya stong pa nyid lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang mi ldan zhing bral bar mi byed de /
analyzed: stong pa nyid shes pa shes bya stong pa nyid lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang mi ldan zhing bral bar mi byed de /
translated: The knowledge of emptiness does not make the knowable empty, which is the emptiness of the afflicted view, free from the afflicted view.

original: lta ba'i stong pa nyid ni bdag nyid kyi lta ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba'i stong pa nyid ni bdag nyid kyi lta ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the emptiness of the afflicted view is not the essential nature of the afflicted view itself.

original: de bzhin du mtshan ma med pa shes pas shes bya mtshan ma med pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i mtshan ma rnams dang bral bar mi byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du mtshan ma med pa shes pas shes bya mtshan ma med pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i mtshan ma rnams dang bral bar mi byed de /
translated: Similarly, the knowledge of signlessness does not make the knowable signless, free from the signs of attachment, etc.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i mtshan ma'i stong pa nyid ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i mtshan ma'i stong pa nyid ni /
translated: Because the emptiness of the signs of attachment, etc.

original: bdag nyid kyi mtshan ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi mtshan ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is not the sign itself.

original: smon pa med pa shes pas shes bya smon par mi byed de /
analyzed: smon pa med pa shes pas shes bya smon par mi byed de /
translated: The knowledge of wishlessness does not make the knowable wishless.

original: smon pa'i stong pa nyid ni rang bzhin gyis smon pa med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smon pa'i stong pa nyid ni rang bzhin gyis smon pa med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the emptiness of wish is characterized by natural wishlessness.

original: mngon par 'du mi byed pa @309b shes pas shes bya mngon par 'du mi byed par mi byed de /
analyzed: mngon par 'du mi byed pa @309b shes pas shes bya mngon par 'du mi byed par mi byed de /
translated: Through the knowledge of non-conditioning, one does not make the cognized object non-conditioned,

original: mngon par 'du byed pa'i stong pa nyid ni rang bzhin gyis mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa'i stong pa nyid ni rang bzhin gyis mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the emptiness of conditioning has the characteristic of being essentially unconditioned.

original: skye ba med pa shes pas shes bya skye ba med par mi byed de /
analyzed: skye ba med pa shes pas shes bya skye ba med par mi byed de /
translated: Through the knowledge of non-production, one does not make the cognized object non-produced,

original: skye ba stong pa nyid ni rang bzhin gyis skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba stong pa nyid ni rang bzhin gyis skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the emptiness of production has the characteristic of being essentially unproduced.

original: 'byung ba med pa shes pas shes bya 'byung ba med par mi byed de /
analyzed: 'byung ba med pa shes pas shes bya 'byung ba med par mi byed de /
translated: Through the knowledge of non-arising, one does not make the cognized object non-arisen,

original: sems dang sems las 'byung ba skad cig re re la 'byung ba'i stong pa nyid ni /
analyzed: sems dang sems las 'byung ba skad cig re re la 'byung ba'i stong pa nyid ni /
translated: because the emptiness of momentariness of mind and mental factors arising in each instant

original: rang bzhin gyis 'byung ba med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'byung ba med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: has the characteristic of being essentially unarisen.

original: ngo bo nyid med par shes pas shes bya'i ngo bo nyid med par mi byed de /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med par shes pas shes bya'i ngo bo nyid med par mi byed de /
translated: Through the knowledge of essencelessness, one does not make the cognized object essenceless,🔽because the emptiness of essence🔽has the characteristic of being essentially essenceless.

original: yang srid pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rang bzhin gyis ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang srid pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rang bzhin gyis ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, the nature of existence is essentially devoid of essence.

original: yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum po de dag dang ci rigs par zhes rgya cher smos pa ni /
analyzed: yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum po de dag dang ci rigs par zhes rgya cher smos pa ni /
translated: Moreover, the three kinds of defilement are to be understood as appropriate.🔽The sevenfold division of the defilement of action and the defilement of life is to be understood as appropriate.

original: nyon mongs pa dang las dang tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa bdun du phye ba dang / shes bya stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi nang nas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang las dang tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa bdun du phye ba dang / shes bya stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi nang nas /
translated: From among the phenomena of the knowable, such as emptiness,

original: chos gang kun nas nyon mongs pa tha dad pa gang dang sbyar bar rigs pa'i chos de ni /
analyzed: chos gang kun nas nyon mongs pa tha dad pa gang dang sbyar bar rigs pa'i chos de ni /
translated: whatever phenomenon is appropriate to be associated with a particular defilement

original: stong pa nyid shes pa la sogs pas stong pa nyid du mi byed kyi shes par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid shes pa la sogs pas stong pa nyid du mi byed kyi shes par bya ba nyid do //
translated: is not made empty by the knowledge of emptiness, etc.

original: de la lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni stong pa nyid shes pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni stong pa nyid shes pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: The defilement of view is to be associated with the knowledge of emptiness.

original: de bzhin du yang srid pa'i rgyun ni ngo bo nyid med pa shes pa dang sbyar ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang srid pa'i rgyun ni ngo bo nyid med pa shes pa dang sbyar ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Similarly, the defilement of the continuity of existence is to be associated with the knowledge of essencelessness.

original: ci'i phyir mi byed ce na 'di ltar /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi byed ce na 'di ltar /
translated: Why not?

original: chos kyi dbyings rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can du ma gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can du ma gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the dharmadhatu is not essentially defiled.

original: de dag rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: They are emptiness, etc.

original: de la ta ba rnams ni stong pa nyid shes pas stong par mi byed de /
analyzed: de la ta ba rnams ni stong pa nyid shes pas stong par mi byed de /
translated: The realists say: One does not make things empty by knowing emptiness,

original: de dag ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are characterized by natural emptiness.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i mtshan ma med pa shes pas mtshan ma med par mi byed de /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i mtshan ma med pa shes pas mtshan ma med par mi byed de /
translated: One does not make things signless by knowing the signlessness of attachment, etc.

original: chos kyi dbyings rang bzhin gyis mtshan ma med pa'i phyir ro //🔽de bzhin du yang srid pa'i rgyun ni ngo bo nyid med par shes pas ngo bo nyid med par mi byed pa'i bar du ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rang bzhin gyis mtshan ma med pa'i phyir ro // de bzhin du yang srid pa'i rgyun ni ngo bo nyid med par shes pas ngo bo nyid med par mi byed pa'i bar du ste /
translated: Because the dharmadhatu is essentially signless.🔽Similarly, one does not make the continuum of existence essenceless by knowing essencelessness,

original: 'di ltar gnyen po ma skyes kyang kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gnyen po ma skyes kyang kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: because even though the antidote has not arisen, the imagined essence does not exist.

original: de dag gi phyir da lta bur gyur pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag gi phyir da lta bur gyur pa de'i phyir /
translated: For that reason,

original: gal te chos kyi dbyings kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gal te chos kyi dbyings kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: if one thinks that the dharmadhatu becomes afflicted or

original: rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'i snyam du rtog pa 'di ni mtha' ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'i snyam du rtog pa 'di ni mtha' ste /
translated: purified, this is an extreme.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de'i phyir / rang bzhin gyis kun @310a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / de'i phyir / rang bzhin gyis kun @310a * //
translated: Why?🔽Therefore, it is said,

original: nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa la ni nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par dag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa la ni nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par dag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: because there is no affliction or purification in that which is not naturally afflicted.

original: nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: It is like space.

original: mtha' de gnyis yongs su spang bar bya ba'i phyir dbu ma'i lam ste gang stong pa nyid rig pa'i bdag nyid kyis shes bya stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi bdag nyid rnams /
analyzed: mtha' de gnyis yongs su spang bar bya ba'i phyir dbu ma'i lam ste gang stong pa nyid rig pa'i bdag nyid kyis shes bya stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi bdag nyid rnams /
translated: In order to abandon those two extremes, there is the middle way, which is the knowledge of emptiness, the nature of the phenomena of the perfected entity, such as the emptiness of the object of knowledge and so on.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid lta ba pa la sogs pa dang bral bar stong par mi byed kyi /
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid lta ba pa la sogs pa dang bral bar stong par mi byed kyi /
translated: It does not make the object empty by being free from the other powered entity, such as views, which is the opposite of that.

original: rig pa ma skyes su zin kyang lta ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos rnams nyid kyis kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: rig pa ma skyes su zin kyang lta ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos rnams nyid kyis kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: Even though awareness has not arisen, phenomena, the reality of views, are empty of the imagined reality.

original: de bzhin du gang mtshan ma med pas chos rnams mtshan ma med par mi byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang mtshan ma med pas chos rnams mtshan ma med par mi byed de /
translated: Similarly, the signless does not make phenomena signless.

original: chos rnams nyid kyis mtshan ma med pa nas /
analyzed: chos rnams nyid kyis mtshan ma med pa nas /
translated: Phenomena themselves are signless, up to

original: ngo bo nyid med pas chos rnams ngo bo nyid med par mi byed de /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pas chos rnams ngo bo nyid med par mi byed de /
translated: the realityless does not make phenomena realityless.

original: chos rnams nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: chos rnams nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Phenomena themselves are realityless.🔽Those who discriminate in this way are said by Kāśyapa to discriminate phenomena correctly.

original: gang dag de ltar so sor rtog pa 'di ni 'od srungs chos rnams la yang dag par so sor rtog pa zhes bya'o / de bzhin du rig pa yod pa dang / de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod pa yang kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral bar bstan pas /
analyzed: gang dag de ltar so sor rtog pa 'di ni 'od srungs chos rnams la yang dag par so sor rtog pa zhes bya'o / de bzhin du rig pa yod pa dang / de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod pa yang kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral bar bstan pas /
translated: Similarly, the existence of awareness and the existence of its counteragent are shown to be free from the imagined reality,

original: sgro btags pa dang bskur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: sgro btags pa dang bskur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' spangs pa yin no //
translated: and so the extremes of superimposition and denial are abandoned.

original: gang rtag tu 'das pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rab tu dbye ba de las 'di ni gzhan yin te rnam par rtog pa'i mtha' gnyis rnam pa bdun no //🔽rnam par rtog pa'i rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: gang rtag tu 'das pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rab tu dbye ba de las 'di ni gzhan yin te rnam par rtog pa'i mtha' gnyis rnam pa bdun no // rnam par rtog pa'i rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir ro /
translated: The two extremes of conceptual differentiation are sevenfold.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: In order to demonstrate the classification of conceptual differentiation, he says:

original: dngos po yod par rnam par rtog pa yang mtha'o //
analyzed: dngos po yod par rnam par rtog pa yang mtha'o //
translated: The conceptual differentiation of existence as an extreme;

original: dngos po med par rnam par rtog pa yang mtha'o zhes pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos po med par rnam par rtog pa yang mtha'o zhes pa smos te /
translated: the conceptual differentiation of non-existence as an extreme.

original: ji lta zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: How is this so? He says:

original: gang zag yod de de gzhig pa'i phyir stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang zag yod de de gzhig pa'i phyir stong pa nyid do //
translated: because of the existence of the personal entity, emptiness is on account of its negation;

original: yang na bdag med pa yang med do snyam du rtog pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: yang na bdag med pa yang med do snyam du rtog pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: or else, because of the notion that there is no selflessness.

original: gal te chos rnams rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir stong pa nyid kyis stong par mi byed na /
analyzed: gal te chos rnams rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir stong pa nyid kyis stong par mi byed na /
translated: If emptiness does not make things empty because they are empty by nature,

original: des na gang zag yod de de gzhig pa'i phyir stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na gang zag yod de de gzhig pa'i phyir stong pa nyid do //
translated: then emptiness is on account of the negation of the personal entity;

original: yang na gang zag med pa'i phyir bdag med pa yang med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na gang zag med pa'i phyir bdag med pa yang med par 'gyur te /
translated: or else, because of the notion that there is no selflessness since there is no personal entity.

original: gnyen po ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyen po ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa ma yin no //
translated: The antidote is not the absence of the adverse factors.

original: de bas na gdon mi za bar gang zag yod pa'am /
analyzed: de bas na gdon mi za bar gang zag yod pa'am /
translated: Therefore, one should understand that the person definitely exists,

original: bdag med pa yang med par shes par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: bdag med pa yang med par shes par bya'o zhe na /
translated: and that the self does not exist.

original: de med pa yang rnam par rtog pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: de med pa yang rnam par rtog pa'i mtha'o //
translated: The nonexistence of that is an extreme of conceptual thought.

original: yod pa dang med par rnam @310b par rtog pa'i mtha'i 'di gnyis spang ba'i phyir dbu ma'i lam 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yod pa dang med par rnam @310b par rtog pa'i mtha'i 'di gnyis spang ba'i phyir dbu ma'i lam 'di lta ste /
translated: In order to abandon these two extremes of conceptual thought, the path of the middle way is as follows:

original: 'od srung gang zag rnam par gzhig pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'od srung gang zag rnam par gzhig pa'i phyir /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is not that emptiness is for the destruction of the person.

original: stong pa nyid ma yin gyi stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo zhes mdo las rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ma yin gyi stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo zhes mdo las rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
translated: The sūtra says, “It is the emptiness of emptiness.”

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi gang zag rnam par gzhig pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i gang zag bskyed par bya ba'i phyir stong pa nyid ma yin gyi gang zag bskyed par bya ba dang / gzhig par bya ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi gang zag rnam par gzhig pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i gang zag bskyed par bya ba'i phyir stong pa nyid ma yin gyi gang zag bskyed par bya ba dang / gzhig par bya ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir /
translated: In this regard, it is not that emptiness is for the destruction of the afflicted person and the production of the purified person.

original: dmag la sogs pa bzhin btags par yod pas stong pa nyid kyis stong gi //
analyzed: dmag la sogs pa bzhin btags par yod pas stong pa nyid kyis stong gi //
translated: It is empty of emptiness, like an army, etc.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta bas gang zag tu sgro btags pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta bas gang zag tu sgro btags pas ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not empty of the person as a fiction superimposed by the false view of individuality,

original: de ni gtan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gtan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is utterly nonexistent.

original: de ltar byas na gang zag dang chos kyi bdag nyid kyis stong pa nyid dngos po ma yin gyi de dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar byas na gang zag dang chos kyi bdag nyid kyis stong pa nyid dngos po ma yin gyi de dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, emptiness of the self of persons and things is not a real existent, because it is devoid of that.

original: yongs su grub pa'i bdag nyid kyis ni dngos po med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i bdag nyid kyis ni dngos po med pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not a non-existent, because of the reality of the perfected nature.

original: stong pa de yongs su grub pa'i bdag nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /🔽sngon gyi mtha' stong pa /
analyzed: stong pa de yongs su grub pa'i bdag nyid du bstan pa'i phyir / sngon gyi mtha' stong pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that emptiness is the perfected nature, he says:🔽The past is empty.

original: phyi ma'i mtha' stong pa /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' stong pa /
translated: The future is empty.

original: da ltar byung ba stong pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba stong pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The present is empty.

original: dus gsum char du yang de bzhin du yod pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dus gsum char du yang de bzhin du yod pa bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows that it exists in the same way in all three times.

original: yang na so so'i skye bo dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa'i dus dag na'ang de bzhin du yod par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: yang na so so'i skye bo dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa'i dus dag na'ang de bzhin du yod par bstan pa ste /
translated: Or else, it shows that it exists in the same way in the states of the ordinary men, the trainees, and the adepts.

original: de la so so'i skye bo'i dus ni sngon gyi mtha'o //
analyzed: de la so so'i skye bo'i dus ni sngon gyi mtha'o //
translated: The time of the ordinary man is the past limit.

original: mi slob pa'i dus ni phyi ma'i mtha'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i dus ni phyi ma'i mtha'o //
translated: The time of the adept is the future limit.

original: slob pa'i dus ni da ltar byung ba'i mtha'o //
analyzed: slob pa'i dus ni da ltar byung ba'i mtha'o //
translated: The time of the learner is the present limit.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yod pa dang med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir 'od srungs stong pa nyid la brten par bya'i zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yod pa dang med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir 'od srungs stong pa nyid la brten par bya'i zhes gsungs te /
translated: And since it is thus that emptiness has the nature of existence and non-existence, therefore, Kāśyapa, one should resort to emptiness.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi yul yin par bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi yul yin par bstan to //
translated: This shows that it is the object of non-conceptual intuition.

original: gang zag la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni brjod pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zag la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni brjod pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But not to the person, because that is mere verbal expression.

original: zhi bar bya bar rnam par rtog pa yang mtha'o //
analyzed: zhi bar bya bar rnam par rtog pa yang mtha'o //
translated: The conception of peace is an extreme.

original: ji lta zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: How so? Therefore he says:

original: spang bar bya ba dang spong bar byed par rtog pas stong pa nyid kyis skrag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //🔽de la zhi bar bya ba ni spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: spang bar bya ba dang spong bar byed par rtog pas stong pa nyid kyis skrag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so // de la zhi bar bya ba ni spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: because of fear of emptiness through the conception of abandonment and the agent of abandonment.🔽Therein, peace is abandonment.

original: zhi bar byed pa ni spong bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: zhi bar byed pa ni spong bar byed pa ste /
translated: The agent of peace is the agent of abandonment.

original: chos rnams ni spang bar bya ba nyid /
analyzed: chos rnams ni spang bar bya ba nyid /
translated: Phenomena are what are to be abandoned.

original: stong pa nyid ni spong bar byed pa brtags nas stong pa nyid la skrag pa skye'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni spong bar byed pa brtags nas stong pa nyid la skrag pa skye'o //
translated: One imagines that emptiness is what abandons, and so one becomes frightened of emptiness.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum ni spang bar bya ba yin na /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum ni spang bar bya ba yin na /
translated: The three types of afflictions are what are to be abandoned.

original: gal te de rang bzhin gyis stong pa lta na go //
analyzed: gal te de rang bzhin gyis stong pa lta na go //
translated: If one sees that they are empty of intrinsic nature,

original: de'i phyir gang zag spang bar bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //🔽spang @311a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zag spang bar bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro // spang @311a * //
translated: then the person would not be what is to be abandoned.🔽If there is nothing to be abandoned, then there is also nothing that abandons.

original: bar bya ba med na spong bar byed pa yang med do zhes stong pa nyid kyi skrag pa skye ste 'di yang mtha' nyid du /
analyzed: bar bya ba med na spong bar byed pa yang med do zhes stong pa nyid kyi skrag pa skye ste 'di yang mtha' nyid du /
translated: Thus, one becomes frightened of emptiness. This is also an extreme.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i chos ji ltar rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid la snang ba de bzhin du de dag rdzas su yod do zhes mngon par chags te /
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i chos ji ltar rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid la snang ba de bzhin du de dag rdzas su yod do zhes mngon par chags te /
translated: One becomes attached to form, feeling, and so on, thinking that these phenomena appear in the nature of consciousness and that they exist substantially just as they appear.

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo'i gzugs la sogs pa de dag bdag bzhin du rang bzhin gyis med par ma shes nas stong pa nyid kyis skrag go //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo'i gzugs la sogs pa de dag bdag bzhin du rang bzhin gyis med par ma shes nas stong pa nyid kyis skrag go //
translated: They are afraid of emptiness because they do not understand that forms and so on, which are imagined natures, are like the self, that is, do not exist essentially.

original: de bas na rnam par rtog pa'i mtha' de gnyis yongs su spang bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na rnam par rtog pa'i mtha' de gnyis yongs su spang bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to completely avoid these two extremes of conceptualization,

original: dpe nam mkha' ste /
analyzed: dpe nam mkha' ste /
translated: the example is space.

original: 'od srungs 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di lta ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is like this:

original: dper na / mi la la nam mkha' la skrag cing 'jigs nas brang rdung zhing du ste /
analyzed: dper na / mi la la nam mkha' la skrag cing 'jigs nas brang rdung zhing du ste /
translated: For example, a man is frightened and terrified of space, beating his chest and crying,

original: nam mkha' ni sol zhes de skad zer na /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni sol zhes de skad zer na /
translated: “Get out of space!”

original: 'od srungs de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: 'od srungs de ji snyam du sems /
translated: Kāśyapa, what do you think?

original: nam mkha' de bsal bar nus sam /
analyzed: nam mkha' de bsal bar nus sam /
translated: Is it possible to get out of space?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni rngo mi thogs lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni rngo mi thogs lags so //
translated: He replied, “Bhagavan, that is not possible.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavan said,

original: 'od srungs de bzhin du dge sbyong ngam bram ze gang dag stong pa nyid kyis skrag rab tu skrag na /
analyzed: 'od srungs de bzhin du dge sbyong ngam bram ze gang dag stong pa nyid kyis skrag rab tu skrag na /
translated: “Kāśyapa, likewise, I say that any renunciants or brahmins who are frightened and terrified of emptiness

original: de dag ni sems 'khrugs pa chen por gyur to zhes nga smra'o //
analyzed: de dag ni sems 'khrugs pa chen por gyur to zhes nga smra'o //
translated: have a great mental disturbance.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na 'od srungs de dag stong pa nyid la spyod na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na 'od srungs de dag stong pa nyid la spyod na /
translated: Why is this? Kāśyapa, if they were to engage with emptiness,🔽

original: de nyid kyis 'jigs pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis 'jigs pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ba'o //
translated: Why is that? Kāśyapa, it is because they are afraid of emptiness itself.

original: de ni 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /🔽ji ltar nam mkha' gzugs thams cad kyi rjes su song bas bsal bar mi nus pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te / ji ltar nam mkha' gzugs thams cad kyi rjes su song bas bsal bar mi nus pa de bzhin du /
translated: This is what is being taught.🔽Just as space cannot be removed from all forms because it pervades them,

original: chos thams cad la stong pa nyid dus thams cad du gnas par bsal bar mi nus te /🔽chos ma spangs pas stong pa nyid gnas pa las bsal bar yang mi nus la /
analyzed: chos thams cad la stong pa nyid dus thams cad du gnas par bsal bar mi nus te / chos ma spangs pas stong pa nyid gnas pa las bsal bar yang mi nus la /
translated: in the same way, emptiness cannot be removed from all phenomena because it pervades them.🔽Since phenomena are not abandoned, emptiness cannot be removed from them.

original: chos bsal bas stong pa nyid gzhag pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: chos bsal bas stong pa nyid gzhag pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And since phenomena are not removed, emptiness cannot be posited.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni skrag pa'i gnas ma yin no zhes ston to //🔽skrag par bya bar rnam par rtog pa yang mtha'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni skrag pa'i gnas ma yin no zhes ston to // skrag par bya bar rnam par rtog pa yang mtha'o //
translated: Therefore, this is not a basis for fear.🔽The conception of something to be afraid of is an extreme.

original: skrag par bya ba de las 'jigs par rnam par rtog pa yang mtha' ste /
analyzed: skrag par bya ba de las 'jigs par rnam par rtog pa yang mtha' ste /
translated: The conception of fear from that which is to be afraid of is also an extreme.

original: gang la 'jigs par 'gyur ba de ni skrag par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang la 'jigs par 'gyur ba de ni skrag par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is to be afraid of is called “that from which one is afraid.”

original: de las 'jigs pa byang bas na 'jigs pa ste /
analyzed: de las 'jigs pa byang bas na 'jigs pa ste /
translated: Fear is that from which one is afraid.

original: de las mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de las mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The undesirable result is that.

original: skrag par bya ba de dang 'jigs pa de la gang rnam par rtog pa de ni mtha' ste /
analyzed: skrag par bya ba de dang 'jigs pa de la gang rnam par rtog pa de ni mtha' ste /
translated: The extreme is the conceptual thought about that which is to be feared and that fear.

original: ji lta zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: How so?

original: sdug bsngal gyis khong sngangs pas kun brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la skrag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis khong sngangs pas kun brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la skrag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He says, because of being frightened by suffering, one is afraid of the imagined form, etc.

original: byis pa ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo gzugs la @311b sogs pa la dngos por kun brtags nas /
analyzed: byis pa ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo gzugs la @311b sogs pa la dngos por kun brtags nas /
translated: The childish, having imagined the imagined nature of form, etc. to be a thing,

original: de dag la mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu 'jigs par rnam par rtog go //
analyzed: de dag la mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu 'jigs par rnam par rtog go //
translated: imagine the undesirable result to be fear in regard to them.

original: de'i phyir sdug bsngal gyis khong sdangs  pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal gyis khong sdangs  pas /
translated: Therefore, because of being frightened by suffering,

original: gzugs la sogs pa de dag dang / de'i mtshan ma rnams kyis 'jigs shing skrag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa de dag dang / de'i mtshan ma rnams kyis 'jigs shing skrag par 'gyur ro //
translated: they are afraid of those forms, etc. and their signs.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i mtha' de gnyis yongs su spang ba'i phyir dpe ri mo mkhan te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i mtha' de gnyis yongs su spang ba'i phyir dpe ri mo mkhan te /
translated: The painter is an example for the purpose of avoiding those two extremes of conceptual thought.

original: 'od srungs 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di lta ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is thus:🔽

original: dper na ri mo mkhan zhig bdag nyid kyis gnod sbyin gyi gzugs 'jigs 'jigs lta zhig bris nas /
analyzed: dper na ri mo mkhan zhig bdag nyid kyis gnod sbyin gyi gzugs 'jigs 'jigs lta zhig bris nas /
translated: For example, a painter, having himself drawn a terrifying demon,

original: des 'jigs skrag ste /
analyzed: des 'jigs skrag ste /
translated: through his own fear of it,🔽falls face down and faints.

original: kha bub tu 'gyel nas brgyal bar gyur pa de bzhin 'od srungs byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams /
analyzed: kha bub tu 'gyel nas brgyal bar gyur pa de bzhin 'od srungs byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams /
translated: Kāśyapa, in the same way, childish ordinary beings,

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa bdag nyid kyis byas pa de dag gis 'khor ba na 'khor yang /
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa bdag nyid kyis byas pa de dag gis 'khor ba na 'khor yang /
translated: through forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and tangible objects that they themselves have created, wander in saṃsāra,

original: chos de dag yang dag pa nyid ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes so zhes 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: chos de dag yang dag pa nyid ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes so zhes 'byung ba'o //
translated: but do not understand those phenomena as they are in reality.

original: ji ltar ri mo mkhan zhig bdag nyid kyis gnod sbyin gyi gzugs 'jigs 'jigs lta zhig bris pa la log par rnam par rtog pas /
analyzed: ji ltar ri mo mkhan zhig bdag nyid kyis gnod sbyin gyi gzugs 'jigs 'jigs lta zhig bris pa la log par rnam par rtog pas /
translated: Just as a painter, having himself drawn a terrifying demon, through his own wrong conceptualization,

original: gnod sbyin gyi dngos po yang dag pa'o snyam du sgro btags te /
analyzed: gnod sbyin gyi dngos po yang dag pa'o snyam du sgro btags te /
translated: superimposes the thought “This is a real demon,”🔽and through that fear, faints,

original: des skrag nas brgyal bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: des skrag nas brgyal bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: in the same way,

original: byis pa log par rnam par rtog pa la zhugs pa skad cig gi gnas skabs thams cad ni /
analyzed: byis pa log par rnam par rtog pa la zhugs pa skad cig gi gnas skabs thams cad ni /
translated: All the moments of the childish who engage in incorrect conception🔽

original: bdag nyid kyis byas pa zhes bya ba bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa dag gis 'khor ba na 'khor te /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis byas pa zhes bya ba bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa dag gis 'khor ba na 'khor te /
translated: The childish, who are engaged in false imagination, revolve in cyclic existence through the self-notions “I did this myself” and so on, in all their momentary states.

original: rigs mthun par skad cig kyang mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs mthun par skad cig kyang mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not remain for a second moment with the same nature.

original: dpe snga ma ni nyan thos la sogs pa las brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: dpe snga ma ni nyan thos la sogs pa las brtsams pa'o //
translated: The previous example is in terms of the śrāvakas and so on.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams las brtsams pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams las brtsams pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: This one is in terms of the bodhisattvas.

original: kha cig na re nyan thos ni stong pa nyid yongs su 'dris par ma byas pas stong pa nyid kyis skrag go //
analyzed: kha cig na re nyan thos ni stong pa nyid yongs su 'dris par ma byas pas stong pa nyid kyis skrag go //
translated: Some say: The śrāvakas, because they have not familiarized themselves with emptiness, are frightened by emptiness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni kun brtags pa'i chos la rnam pa kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni kun brtags pa'i chos la rnam pa kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas are afflicted by the imagined phenomena,

original: rnam par rtog pa ni nyon mongs pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni nyon mongs pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: because imagination is the cause of affliction.

original: gzhan dag na re 'di gnyis la don du bye brag med mod kyi ris gnyis kyi dbang gis gnyis su brjod do zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'di gnyis la don du bye brag med mod kyi ris gnyis kyi dbang gis gnyis su brjod do zhe'o //
translated: Others say: In fact, there is no difference between these two, but they are spoken of as two because of the two types.

original: gzhan dag na re nyan thos ni stong pa nyid kyis skrag pa'i phyir rtogs par bya ba ma rtogs so //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re nyan thos ni stong pa nyid kyis skrag pa'i phyir rtogs par bya ba ma rtogs so //
translated: Others say: The Sravakas do not understand what is to be understood because they are frightened by emptiness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni rnam par brtags pa'i chos kyis skrag pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //🔽kha cig na re snga ma ni bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gnyen @312a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni rnam par brtags pa'i chos kyis skrag pa'i phyir ro zhe'o // kha cig na re snga ma ni bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gnyen @312a * //
translated: The Bodhisattvas are frightened by the imagined dharmas.

original: po'o // 'di ni chos su 'dzin pa'i gnyen po'o zhe'o //🔽gzung bar rnam par rtog pa yang mtha'o //
analyzed: po'o // 'di ni chos su 'dzin pa'i gnyen po'o zhe'o // gzung bar rnam par rtog pa yang mtha'o //
translated: Some say: The former is the antidote to the apprehension of self, and this is the antidote to the apprehension of dharmas.🔽The imagination of the apprehended is an extreme.

original: 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa yang mtha'o //
analyzed: 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa yang mtha'o //
translated: The imagination of the apprehender is an extreme.

original: gzung ba gzugs la sogs pa dang / de la 'dzin pa rnam par shes pa'i tshogs de dag rang gi mtshan nyid dang / 'bras bus shes par byar yod bzhin du /
analyzed: gzung ba gzugs la sogs pa dang / de la 'dzin pa rnam par shes pa'i tshogs de dag rang gi mtshan nyid dang / 'bras bus shes par byar yod bzhin du /
translated: The apprehended is form, etc., and the apprehender is the groups of consciousness.

original: bdag la sogs pa dang 'dra bar sgro btags pa'i bdag nyid du ji ltar 'gyur zhes /
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa dang 'dra bar sgro btags pa'i bdag nyid du ji ltar 'gyur zhes /
translated: How could it be the self that is imagined to be like a self, etc.?

original: de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis la dngos por yongs su rtog pa ni 'dir mthar 'dod do //
analyzed: de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis la dngos por yongs su rtog pa ni 'dir mthar 'dod do //
translated: Thus, the imagination of the reality of the duality of the grasped and grasper is here considered to be the extreme of conceptual differentiation.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i mtha' de gnyis yongs su spang ba'i phyir /🔽dpe sgyu ma bye ba pa ste ;
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i mtha' de gnyis yongs su spang ba'i phyir / dpe sgyu ma bye ba pa ste ;
translated: In order to completely avoid these two extremes of conceptual differentiation,

original: 'od srungs 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di lta ste /
translated: the example of the hundred coin wager is taught.🔽As it is said: Kāśyapa, it is thus.

original: dper na sgyu ma byed pa'i mi zhig gis sgyu ma sprul pa sprul nas /
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma byed pa'i mi zhig gis sgyu ma sprul pa sprul nas /
translated: For example, a magician conjures up a magical creation,

original: sgyu ma sprul ba des sgyu ma byed pa de nyid zos pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: sgyu ma sprul ba des sgyu ma byed pa de nyid zos pa de bzhin du /
translated: and that magical creation eats the magician himself.

original: 'od srungs dge slong rnal 'byor spyod pa dmigs pa gang dang gang yid la byed pa da dag thams cad de la gsog tu snang ngo zhes rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'od srungs dge slong rnal 'byor spyod pa dmigs pa gang dang gang yid la byed pa da dag thams cad de la gsog tu snang ngo zhes rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
translated: In the same way, Kāśyapa, whatever object a monk who practices yoga takes to mind, all that appears to him as void.

original: ji ltar 'dis rnam par rtog pa'i mtha' 'di gnyis yongs su spong zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dis rnam par rtog pa'i mtha' 'di gnyis yongs su spong zhe na /
translated: How does this completely avoid these two extremes of conceptual differentiation?

original: de'i phyir / rnam par rig pa tsam du shes pas don dngos po med par shes par byas nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir / rnam par rig pa tsam du shes pas don dngos po med par shes par byas nas /
translated: having understood that objects are unreal by understanding that they are mere representations,

original: don dngos po med par shes pa des kyang rnam par rig pa tsam du shes pa de nyid rnam par bzlog go //
analyzed: don dngos po med par shes pa des kyang rnam par rig pa tsam du shes pa de nyid rnam par bzlog go //
translated: that understanding of the unreality of objects causes the very understanding that they are mere representations to be abandoned.

original: don dngos po med na rnam par shes pa mi srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: don dngos po med na rnam par shes pa mi srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because if objects are unreal, consciousness is impossible.

original: de ltar na 'di ni 'dir mtshungs so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni 'dir mtshungs so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus, this is similar to that.

original: sgyu ma byed pa lta bu ni rnam par rig pa tsam du shes pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma byed pa lta bu ni rnam par rig pa tsam du shes pa'o //
translated: The understanding that they are mere representations is like the magician.

original: sprul pa'i gnod sbyin lta bu ni don dngos po med par shes pa ste /
analyzed: sprul pa'i gnod sbyin lta bu ni don dngos po med par shes pa ste /
translated: The understanding that objects are unreal is like the magical creation, the yakṣa.

original: don dngos po med par shes pa ni rnam par rig pa tsam du shes pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dngos po med par shes pa ni rnam par rig pa tsam du shes pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the understanding that objects are unreal is distinguished by the understanding that they are mere representations.

original: ji ltar sprul pa byed pa sprul pa zos pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar sprul pa byed pa sprul pa zos pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the creator of the magical creation eats the magical creation,

original: don dngos po med par shes pas kyang rnam par rig pa tsam du shes pa de nyid zos te /
analyzed: don dngos po med par shes pas kyang rnam par rig pa tsam du shes pa de nyid zos te /
translated: in the same way, the understanding that objects are unreal consumes the very understanding that they are mere representations.

original: don la dmigs pa ni rnam par rig pa zhes bya bas /
analyzed: don la dmigs pa ni rnam par rig pa zhes bya bas /
translated: The object is the domain of consciousness.

original: don med na rnam par rig pa tsam yang med pa'i phyir ro //🔽yang dag pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa yang mtha'o//
analyzed: don med na rnam par rig pa tsam yang med pa'i phyir ro // yang dag pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa yang mtha'o//
translated: If there is no object, there is no consciousness.🔽The extreme of reality is the extreme of unreality.

original: log pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa yang mtha' ste /🔽nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dus na yang dag par so sor rtog pa na yang dag pa nyid du'am /
analyzed: log pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa yang mtha' ste / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dus na yang dag par so sor rtog pa na yang dag pa nyid du'am /
translated: The extreme of reality is the extreme of unreality.

original: log pa nyid du rtogs pa'i mtha' gnyis so //
analyzed: log pa nyid du rtogs pa'i mtha' gnyis so //
translated: When one is in the stage of the aids to penetration, if one discriminates reality, there are two extremes: the extreme of reality and the extreme of unreality.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: yang dag pa nyid ni zag pa med pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid ni zag pa med pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: Reality is the uncontaminated dharmas.

original: log pa nyid ni zag @312b pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: log pa nyid ni zag @312b pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: Unreality is the contaminated dharmas.

original: de la gal te yang dag par so sor rtog pa na dag pa nyid du chags na /
analyzed: de la gal te yang dag par so sor rtog pa na dag pa nyid du chags na /
translated: If, discriminating reality, one is attached to reality,

original: de lta na ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i dge ba dang / yang dag par so sor rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i dge ba dang / yang dag par so sor rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then one will not discriminate the contaminated good dharmas.

original: ji ste yang dag pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid kho na'i snyam na /
analyzed: ji ste yang dag pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid kho na'i snyam na /
translated: If one thinks that they are only of unreal characteristics,🔽then one will not discriminate the uncontaminated good dharmas.

original: de lta yang khams gsum dang ldan pa'i dge ba bzhin du log pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yang khams gsum dang ldan pa'i dge ba bzhin du log pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: But like virtue that belongs to the three realms, it would be wrong.

original: mtha' de gnyis yongs su spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mtha' de gnyis yongs su spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is the middle way that abandons those two extremes.

original: dpe shing gnyis la me 'byung ba de /
analyzed: dpe shing gnyis la me 'byung ba de /
translated: The example is the fire that arises from two sticks.

original: 'od srungs 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di lta ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is like this.

original: dper na shing gnyis rlung gis drud pa las me byung ste /
analyzed: dper na shing gnyis rlung gis drud pa las me byung ste /
translated: For example, fire arises from two sticks rubbed together,

original: byung ma thag tu shing de gnyis tshig par byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: byung ma thag tu shing de gnyis tshig par byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: and as soon as it arises, it burns up those two sticks.

original: 'od srungs yang dag par so sor rtog pa yod na 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi dbang po skye ste /
analyzed: 'od srungs yang dag par so sor rtog pa yod na 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi dbang po skye ste /
translated: In the same way, Kāśyapa, when there is correct analytical discrimination, the ārya’s faculty of wisdom arises,

original: skyes ma thag tu yang dag par so sor rtog pa nyid tshig par byed do zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: skyes ma thag tu yang dag par so sor rtog pa nyid tshig par byed do zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: and as soon as it arises, it burns up correct analytical discrimination itself.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: dper na me'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa shing gnyis las me 'byung ste /
analyzed: dper na me'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa shing gnyis las me 'byung ste /
translated: For example, fire arises from two sticks that do not have the characteristics of fire,

original: byung nas kyang shing gnyis tshig par byed do //
analyzed: byung nas kyang shing gnyis tshig par byed do //
translated: and once it arises, it burns up those two sticks.

original: de bzhin du yang dag pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ma yin pa yang dag par so sor rtog pa las /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ma yin pa yang dag par so sor rtog pa las /
translated: Likewise, from the correct analytical discernment of what is not the characteristic of reality,

original: yang dag pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi dbang po skye ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi dbang po skye ste /
translated: the noble faculty of wisdom that is the characteristic of reality arises.

original: skyes nas kyang yang dag par so sor rtog pa nyid tshig par byed de /
analyzed: skyes nas kyang yang dag par so sor rtog pa nyid tshig par byed de /
translated: And having arisen, it burns up correct analytical discernment itself.

original: rnam par 'jig par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par 'jig par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it destroys it.

original: rnam par 'jig pa de yang tshig pa dang 'dra bar byed pas na tshig par byed ces bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par 'jig pa de yang tshig pa dang 'dra bar byed pas na tshig par byed ces bya ste /
translated: And that destruction is like burning, so it is called burning.

original: gyur par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gyur par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is seen to be transformed.

original: yang dag par so sor rtog pa 'di zag pa dang bcas pa yin yang /
analyzed: yang dag par so sor rtog pa 'di zag pa dang bcas pa yin yang /
translated: Although this correct analytical discernment is contaminated,

original: yang dag pa nyid kyi rjes su mthun pa'i phyir yang dag par so sor rtog pa zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid kyi rjes su mthun pa'i phyir yang dag par so sor rtog pa zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: it is taught that it is called correct analytical discernment because it is in accord with reality.

original: byed par rnam par rtog pa yang mtha'o //
analyzed: byed par rnam par rtog pa yang mtha'o //
translated: The conceptualization of activity is an extreme.

original: mi byed par rnam par rtog pa yang mtha' ste /
analyzed: mi byed par rnam par rtog pa yang mtha' ste /
translated: The conceptualization of inactivity is also an extreme.

original: ji lta zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: How so?

original: ye shes ni blo sngon du 'gro bas byed pa'am /
analyzed: ye shes ni blo sngon du 'gro bas byed pa'am /
translated: Wisdom is the agent because it precedes the mind.

original: mthu med par rtog pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: mthu med par rtog pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Or, it is the conception that there is no power.

original: gal te ye shes 'dis mi shes pa spong ngo snyam du rtogs nas de spang ba'i phyir 'jug go zhes bya ba 'di ni byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: gal te ye shes 'dis mi shes pa spong ngo snyam du rtogs nas de spang ba'i phyir 'jug go zhes bya ba 'di ni byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i mtha'o //
translated: If one conceives that this wisdom eliminates nescience, and engages in order to eliminate it, this is the extreme of the conception of the agent.

original: ye shes ni skad cig pa yin pas spyod pa byed pa'i dus na mi srid de /
analyzed: ye shes ni skad cig pa yin pas spyod pa byed pa'i dus na mi srid de /
translated: Since wisdom is momentary, it is impossible that it function at the time of the elimination of nescience.

original: de bas na mi shes pa spang ba'i mthu med do zhes bya ba 'di ni mi byed par rnam par rtog pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: de bas na mi shes pa spang ba'i mthu med do zhes bya ba 'di ni mi byed par rnam par rtog pa'i mtha'o //
translated: Therefore, it has no power to eliminate nescience. This is the extreme of the conception of the nonagent.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i mtha' de gnyis yongs su spang ba'i phyir dpe mar me ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i mtha' de gnyis yongs su spang ba'i phyir dpe mar me ste /
translated: The example of the lamp is in order to avoid these two extremes of conception.

original: 'od srungs 'di @313a * //🔽lta ste / dper na mar me byung na mun pa mun nag thams cad med par 'gyur yang /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di @313a * // lta ste / dper na mar me byung na mun pa mun nag thams cad med par 'gyur yang /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is like this:🔽for example, when a lamp is lit, all the darkness disappears.

original: 'od srungs mar me 'di ltar bdag gis mun pa mun nag thams cad bsal lo snyam du mi sems mod kyi /
analyzed: 'od srungs mar me 'di ltar bdag gis mun pa mun nag thams cad bsal lo snyam du mi sems mod kyi /
translated: Kāśyapa, the lamp does not think, “I will eliminate all the darkness.”

original: 'on kyang mar me la brten nas mun pa mun nag med par 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'od srungs ye shes skyes na ni mi shes pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang mar me la brten nas mun pa mun nag med par 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'od srungs ye shes skyes na ni mi shes pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: But just as darkness is removed by the presence of a lamp, so too, Kāśyapa, when wisdom arises, ignorance is removed.

original: ye shes ni 'di snyam du bdag gis mi shes pa bsal lo snyam du mi sems mod kyi /
analyzed: ye shes ni 'di snyam du bdag gis mi shes pa bsal lo snyam du mi sems mod kyi /
translated: Wisdom does not think, “I will remove ignorance.”

original: 'on kyang ye shes la brten nas /
analyzed: 'on kyang ye shes la brten nas /
translated: But in dependence on wisdom,

original: mun pa med par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: mun pa med par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba'o //
translated: ignorance is removed.

original: 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is taught as follows.

original: dper na mar me ni byed pas stong zhing mun pa mun nag bsal bar bsam pa med kyang /
analyzed: dper na mar me ni byed pas stong zhing mun pa mun nag bsal bar bsam pa med kyang /
translated: For example, a lamp is empty of the action of removing darkness and does not think, “I will remove darkness.”

original: phyogs dang du byung ba'i phyogs der mar me yod pa tsam gyis mun pa mun nag thams cad med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs dang du byung ba'i phyogs der mar me yod pa tsam gyis mun pa mun nag thams cad med par 'gyur ro //
translated: But when a lamp is present in a place, all the darkness there is removed just by the presence of the lamp.

original: de bzhin du rgyud gang la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes skyes par gyur na de yod pa tsam gyis rgyud de las mi shes pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyud gang la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes skyes par gyur na de yod pa tsam gyis rgyud de las mi shes pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, when nonconceptual wisdom arises in a mindstream, just by its presence, ignorance is removed from that mindstream.

original: ye shes ni rnam par mi rtog pa dang / dpyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes ni rnam par mi rtog pa dang / dpyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Wisdom is non-conceptual and non-analytical.

original: de ltar ye shes ni byed pa'i mthu med la /
analyzed: de ltar ye shes ni byed pa'i mthu med la /
translated: Thus, wisdom is powerless to act.

original: mar me bzhin du yod pa tsam gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs sel to //
analyzed: mar me bzhin du yod pa tsam gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs sel to //
translated: Like a lamp, it removes the opposing side by its mere presence.

original: skye ba med par rnam par rtog pa yang mtha'o //
analyzed: skye ba med par rnam par rtog pa yang mtha'o //
translated: The conceptualization of non-arising is an extreme.

original: dus mnyam pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa yang mtha'o //
analyzed: dus mnyam pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa yang mtha'o //
translated: The conceptualization of simultaneity is also an extreme.

original: ji lta zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: How so? Therefore, it is said:

original: gal te gnyen po ma skyes pa'am zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gal te gnyen po ma skyes pa'am zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If the antidote has not arisen, or...

original: de ltar dus ji srid du sngon gnyen po ma skyes pa de bzhin du da yang mi skye'o snyam pa 'di ni skye ba med par rtog pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: de ltar dus ji srid du sngon gnyen po ma skyes pa de bzhin du da yang mi skye'o snyam pa 'di ni skye ba med par rtog pa'i mtha'o //
translated: Thus, for as long as the antidote has not arisen before, it will not arise now either. This is the extreme of conceptualizing non-arising.

original: yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa yun ring ba nyid du rtog pa zhes bya ba ni mi shes pa dang / ye shes mi mthun par gnas pas ye shes 'byung ba'i mthu med do //
analyzed: yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa yun ring ba nyid du rtog pa zhes bya ba ni mi shes pa dang / ye shes mi mthun par gnas pas ye shes 'byung ba'i mthu med do //
translated: Or, the conceptualization of long-lasting affliction means that due to ignorance abiding in opposition to wisdom, wisdom has no power to arise.

original: ji ste brgya la skyes su zin na yang mi shes pa de yun ring po nas gnas gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ste brgya la skyes su zin na yang mi shes pa de yun ring po nas gnas gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: Even if it were to arise, it would not be known because it would have existed for a long time.

original: ye shes skad cig pa des bsal bar bya mi nus so //
analyzed: ye shes skad cig pa des bsal bar bya mi nus so //
translated: Even if it were to arise, it would not be able to dispel the darkness because the darkness has remained for a long time.

original: de bas na nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba gnyis dus mnyam pa nyid do snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i mtha' de gnyis yongs su spang ba'i phyir mar me'i dpe gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba gnyis dus mnyam pa nyid do snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i mtha' de gnyis yongs su spang ba'i phyir mar me'i dpe gnyis pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the two extremes of the conception that both affliction and purification are simultaneous are completely abandoned by the second example of the lamp.

original: 'od srungs 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di lta ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is like this.

original: dper na khyim mam khang pa'am khang phran lo brgya stong 'das par sus kyang lan 'ga' yang mar me ma bus pa der mi la la zhig gis mar @313b me bus na /
analyzed: dper na khyim mam khang pa'am khang phran lo brgya stong 'das par sus kyang lan 'ga' yang mar me ma bus pa der mi la la zhig gis mar @313b me bus na /
translated: For example, in a house, a building, or a small room where no one has lit a lamp for a hundred thousand years, if someone were to light a lamp there,

original: 'od srungs de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: 'od srungs de ji snyam du sems /
translated: Kāśyapa, what do you think?

original: mun pa mun nag de 'di ltar bdag ni lo brgya stong du bsags pa yin te /
analyzed: mun pa mun nag de 'di ltar bdag ni lo brgya stong du bsags pa yin te /
translated: Would that darkness think, “I have accumulated for a hundred thousand years,

original: bdag 'di nas mi 'gro'o snyam du sems sam /
analyzed: bdag 'di nas mi 'gro'o snyam du sems sam /
translated: I will not go from here”?

original: gsol ba bcom ldan 'das mi sems te /
analyzed: gsol ba bcom ldan 'das mi sems te /
translated: He replied, “Bhagavān, it would not think that.”

original: mar me byung na mun pa mun nag la mi mchi ba'i nus pa ma mchis kyi /
analyzed: mar me byung na mun pa mun nag la mi mchi ba'i nus pa ma mchis kyi /
translated: When a lamp is lit, it has the power to dispel the darkness.

original: gdon mi 'tshal bar ma mchis par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gdon mi 'tshal bar ma mchis par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is certain that the darkness will be dispelled.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: 'od srungs de bzhin du las dang nyon mongs pa bskal pa brgya stong du bsags pa yang tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i so sor rtog pa gcig gis med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'od srungs de bzhin du las dang nyon mongs pa bskal pa brgya stong du bsags pa yang tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i so sor rtog pa gcig gis med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Kāśyapa, likewise, even karma and afflictions accumulated over a hundred thousand eons are eliminated by a single moment of proper mental attention and discernment.

original: 'od srungs mar me zhes bya ba de ni 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi dbang po'i tshig bla dags so //
analyzed: 'od srungs mar me zhes bya ba de ni 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi dbang po'i tshig bla dags so //
translated: Kāśyapa, what is called a lamp is a synonym for the noble faculty of wisdom.

original: 'od srungs mun pa mun nag ces bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i tshig bla dags so zhes 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'od srungs mun pa mun nag ces bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i tshig bla dags so zhes 'byung ba'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, what is called darkness is a synonym for karma and afflictions.

original: de lta bas na 'dis ni skye ba rkyen las rag las pa'i phyir gnyen po mi skye ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang / dus mnyam pa nyid kyi lan btab pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dis ni skye ba rkyen las rag las pa'i phyir gnyen po mi skye ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang / dus mnyam pa nyid kyi lan btab pa ste /
translated: Therefore, this shows the response to the objection that the antidote does not arise and the afflicted side are simultaneous, because arising depends on conditions.

original: nag po'i phyogs stobs chung zhing gnyen po de stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir mun pa mun nag dang mar me bzhin no //
analyzed: nag po'i phyogs stobs chung zhing gnyen po de stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir mun pa mun nag dang mar me bzhin no //
translated: because the side of darkness is weak and the antidote is strong, like darkness and a lamp.

original: mtha' gnyis spangs pa sgrub pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis spangs pa sgrub pa bshad zin to //
translated: The accomplishment of the avoidance of the two extremes has been explained.

original: mtha' gnyis spangs pa sgrub pa'i 'og tu khyad par can dang khyad par med pa sgrub pa smos pas /
analyzed: mtha' gnyis spangs pa sgrub pa'i 'og tu khyad par can dang khyad par med pa sgrub pa smos pas /
translated: After the accomplishment of the avoidance of the two extremes, the accomplishment of the distinctive and the undistinctive is mentioned.

original: de'i phyir mtha' gnyis spangs pa sgrub pa bshad pa'i 'og tu khyad par can dang / khyad par med pa sgrub pa gang zhe na zhes dris pa dang / de'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir mtha' gnyis spangs pa sgrub pa bshad pa'i 'og tu khyad par can dang / khyad par med pa sgrub pa gang zhe na zhes dris pa dang / de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, after the explanation of the accomplishment of the avoidance of the two extremes, the question is asked: What is the accomplishment of the distinctive and the undistinctive?🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: khyad par can dang khyad med ni //
analyzed: khyad par can dang khyad med ni //
translated: The distinctive and the undistinctive

original: sa bcu dag tu shes par bya //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: sa bcu dag tu shes par bya // zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: should be known in the ten stages.

original: sa bcu po de dag re re la yang sgrub pa rnam pa gnyi ga'o //
analyzed: sa bcu po de dag re re la yang sgrub pa rnam pa gnyi ga'o //
translated: Each of the ten stages has both kinds of accomplishment.

original: ji lta zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: How is that? Therefore it is said:
